alert.note: Alert for Lower Terrebonne; Upper Terrebonne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Terrebonne Parish through 300 PM CDT... At 230 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Dulac, or 8 miles southwest of Houma, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Houma, Dulac, Cocodrie, Bayou Cane, Schriever, Gray, Chauvin, Tambour Bay Buoy and Lumcon Center Buoy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
